What not everyone knows is that they have also made a substantial effort in the past few years to become a player in the cell phone market.
author: David Pearlman
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Laser Unlocked Smartphone, 3GB RAM, 32GB Storage

extract: I bought this phone based on the specs, which are amazing for the price, but it was too good to be true. First off, the Zenfone 2 comes preloaded with so much useless bloatware it's almost comical.
author: Caz
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: For the price, you're getting a good product with two sim slots and a MicroSD storage expansion slot, although it lacks wireless charging. The biggest annoyance for me was that the phone came pre-loaded with tons of ASUS bloat ware and redundant apps/services that were just ASUS-branded clones of...
author: Demitri
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: Won't work with AT&T LTE, unless you already have a phone whose sim card has a AT&T account. I bought this because it said it worked with AT&T, I ported my number from another carrier, it won't recognize LTE from the brand new sim card I got when it was activated.
author: gizmo99
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: I bought this phone a month ago. At first I thought I was just using it too much in the beginning (as we all do with new phones), as my battery would drain very fast (had to recharge it at least once a day or even more).
author: Amazon Customer
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Cellphone, 64GB, Black (U.S. Warranty)

extract: I buy this phone because was 4 star Cheap Dual Sim Card, i get this phone for traveling, at 4 days of use took at lot of pictures and videos, i got the cellphone full memory error, so after that the cell phone dies never boot up.

product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: Sim card stopped detecting itself after less than 3 months of usage. I tried getting a new sim card from AT&T, but it didn't work either. I also tried cleaning the Sim card slot. I wouldn't recommend this product.
author: Janice L.
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: Zenfone2 , its like the red head stepchild of a smartphone. I hate it. Poor software makes it difficult to own and starting back at the beginning every time you go into an app, even when it's suppose to be running in the background frustrates the hell out of me.

product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: I like the phone a lot! it is quite good only the battery is its downside other than that all good!!
author: Shafat
product: ASUS ZENFONE2 5.5" Intel 1.8GHZ 2GB RAM 16GB Storage Silver

extract: I got this as an upgrade to the venerable HTC HD2, and let me say, is it quite the upgrade. It has equal (and in some cases, better) specs than a Galaxy S4, and is $100 cheaper (I got the 16GB). I've had it for a little over a week now, and it's excelled at everything I've thrown at it so far.
author: ThunderBanana
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: I dropped my AT&T LG G3 midway through my contract with them -- twice. The first time I replaced the screen and digitizer myself, but that lead to a sort of Pet Sematary situation where the phone kind of worked, but it wasn't quite right. Then I dropped it again and that was really the end of it.
author: David Hunter
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: Have had the phone 1 month. Two issues. The major one is operational. This phone is slow. I mean bad slow. I bought two of them, one for myself and one for my wife. They both behave the same way. Press an application icon, 3-5 seconds later it opens. Screens intermittently lock up.
author: Soul Sister
product: Asus AT&T Zenfone 2E (AT&T Go Phone) No Annual Contract

extract: I have waited to write this review for several weeks and can only confirm that this is one of the best unlocked smartphones on the market. I have been thoroughly satisfied with the screen quality, battery life, voice and GPS signal quality as well as the photos it takes.
author: Jacob
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: I like the actual phone. Yes, mods that ASUS has made to Android are klunky, Lollipop seems to be taking forever, but it is a very capable phone. It is fast, I can expand the storage via a memory card, the camera is decent, and the price is nice. The problem with the phone is support.
author: Rob R
product: Asus ZenFone 2 Unlocked Cellphone , 64GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: If you are debating on whether to get this phone or not, hopefully this review can help. I bought this phone simply because, like many of you, I cannot afford 700 on a freakin' smartphone. So when I saw the price tag on this phone I found it very attractive.
author: omar tavarez
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: My in laws were looking for new phones to replace there 5 year old smartphones. After weighing there options with carriers, they decided to try straight talk and leave sprint. I was approached with the question " what unlocked smartphone should we buy"? Right off the bat I had two phones in mind.
author: Chaz T. Bryner
product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: I bought a Nexus 6 in January. Someone stole it. I didn't want to pay $750 for a phone this time, so I did some research which led me to Zen. Zenfone 2, that is. Who knew it would wow me more than the Nexus 6? I got the Nexus 6 because my Nexus 4 cracked.
author: RefinedEnough
product: Asus ZenFone 2 Unlocked Cellphone, 64GB, Red (U.S. Warranty)

extract: Purchased two of these phones and inserted a Sandisk 32GB EVO microsd card. Placed Music in a Music folder and Pictures in the DCIM\Camera folder. The factory software Gallery and Music app will not read anything from the Removable SD card.

product: Asus AT&T Zenfone 2E (AT&T Go Phone) No Annual Contract

extract: Good phone. The screen has a very nice resolution and the proccesor is sufficient for the price. You won't be doing any hardcore gaming, but you can make that up by listening to music with the back speakers. Definitely worth it.

product: Asus AT&T Zenfone 2E (AT&T Go Phone) No Annual Contract

extract: I've had the phone about 3 weeks. It fell out of my pocket while I was laying on the ground, ON THE GROUND, and the screen shattered! The phone fell maybe an inch from my pocket to the ground, but still the screen shattered! Talk about poor quality!

product: Asus ZenFone 2 Unlocked Cellphone , 64GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: There r many issues like over heating, call drop, battery draining etc. It is preferable to go for the newer model ASUS ZENFONE 2 LAZER which has a snapdragon processor to improve battery life and overall performance.

extract: I won't go into too many details about the phone itself, as I'm sure many other reviewers have covered it. For reference, I purchased the 64GB version both times. As I have looked around since May, the ZenFone 2 is the best value for the price, and nothing comes close to it.

extract: Good phone I love it

extract: First unit I received the the led didn't work so got it replaced. This phone is awesome. It is fast and made well. Reviews say the screen is too dark but I have not see this issue. It is bright and vivid.

extract: Received the phone on 6/23/2015. It worked perfectly until an ASUS-provided firmware update on 7/3/2015. All of a sudden, the phone would sporadically lose network connection (full bars to 0 bars, back to full bars, etc) and resulted in me being unable to reliably place or receive calls and texts.

product: Asus ZenFone 2 Unlocked Cellphone , 64GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: Been using my new zenfone to for two days now, I'm loving it first thing I did was look for the update, I got the phone updated then I uninstalled all the bloatware I could and I turn the screen up and it's working great I put on the Google now launcher and it's ui running just like my Nexus 4 did.

product: Asus ZenFone 2 Unlocked Cellphone, 64GB, Red (U.S. Warranty)

extract: The first one of these I received was busted. The software was not installed properly or something like that, but I exchanged it for another one because lemons do happen. I have been enjoying the second one very much so.

product: Asus ZenFone 2 Unlocked Cellphone, 64GB, Red (U.S. Warranty)

extract: For the price versus the specs, this phone is by far worth it and every penny involved. I got exactly what I was looking for, a high end spec phone with mid ranged price. Granted, it has it's quirks, but it's my fastest android to date.

product: ASUS ZenFone 2 Unlocked Smartphone, 16GB, Silver (U.S. Warranty)

extract: For the first phone I got - 5 stars for the hardware - zero stars for the software. Asus' Android version ZenUI is a complete load of @#$%. It tries to be nice and helpful but it slows the phone and makes it unusuable for periods of time.

extract: Built-in apps aren't great, but downloading the usual Android apps isn't difficult. Love the storage space, big screen, and snappiness. Some apps don't run (my banking app, for example), and others crash more often, but as a whole not too much to complain about.

extract: As a cheap smartphone, the BLU Win JR is a fairly high-spec, well designed device that features adequate memory, a passable phone, a decent touchscreen and surprisingly good battery life (2 days in my testing). In its price category, you'll be pushed to find anything substantially better.

author: j.burrage

extract: When my mom gave me some money to buy my very first mobile phone, I chose this unit because it actually caught my site. It is indeed attractive to look at-- it's small enough, the shape fits good on one hand, and its color is very nice. It also says that it has a 4-liners display.

extract: Unlike the picture on this page, The Maxon is not small, it is not good. It is a four line text only display. It is very heavy and not particuly easy to use , the laberenth of menus does not help the matter. Although it isnt perfect, it is very cheap, and comes in a range of colours.
author: sunstorm2k

extract: This phone is OK. It's very basic and does a job. I got this phone when I bought a Vodafone Pay As You Talk last year and my phone is nearly a year old and is still working perfectly. The battery life is quite short, mine needs charged every 36 hours. I hate the display.
author: hugon

extract: This is an alright phone. It really isn't very special, it just does a job and nothing else. My major gripe is the display, it looks very dated and eighties-like. Saying that it is easy to use. The battery life isn't great, it needs recharged every night.
